title: Macron Recognizes a Palestinian State. But to What End?
summary: The French president, expressing a moral obligation to address suffering in Gaza, made clear he had lost patience with the United States and Israel. The question is what effect he will have.

title: Israel to Allow Aid Airdrops Over Gaza During Starvation Crisis
summary: Jordan and the United Arab Emirates were expected to begin airdrops in the coming days, but experts warned that the bulk of necessary aid could come only by land.

title: Behind Trump’s War With Powell: A Battering Ram With 3 Million Followers
summary: The director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency has made the removal of the Fed chair his personal mission.

title: Gabbard’s Attacks on Obama Put the Attorney General in a Tough Spot
summary: The director of national intelligence gave the Justice Department little warning before she demanded an investigation.

title: Trump Flies to Scotland, Leaving Chaos Swirling in Washington
summary: The five-day visit will be a mix of personal business and golf, with some diplomacy thrown in.

title: Justice Dept. Officials File Suit, Saying They Were Dismissed Unlawfully
summary: The lawsuit argues that employees who were fired for political reasons have no recourse, after President Trump neutralized a board that handles federal labor disputes.

title: Trump’s Name Is on Contributor List for Epstein Birthday Book
summary: The Times also reviewed other records of the president’s friendship with Jeffrey Epstein, including an inscription in which the future president called him “the greatest.”

title: Hulk Hogan’s Villainous Turn Changed Pro Wrestling
summary: Hulk Hogan cultivated an image as an all-American hero. But one night in 1996, he decided to stick it to his fans, brother.

title: Hulk Hogan Used Clothing As a Key Part of His Brand
summary: His look was jokey, but it was no joke.

title: As Consumers Lose Their Appetite, Food Brands Fight to Keep Wall St. Happy
summary: Packaged food companies are struggling to adjust — and profit — as tastes, waistlines and wallets change.

title: Under Siege From Trump and Musk, a Top Liberal Group Falls Into Crisis
summary: Scrambling to pay legal fees, Media Matters has dialed back its criticism, trimmed its staff and contemplated closing entirely.

title: U.S. Conducts Rare Raid in Syria, Killing a Senior Islamic State Leader
summary: The military gave few details on the ground operation, but counterterrorism raids have typically involved helicopter-borne Special Operations commandos.

title: Columbia Walked a Tightrope on Its Way to a $200 Million Settlement With Trump
summary: Talks in Washington. An expert on negotiation. A balancing act. The university chose cooperation over litigation, a strategy both pilloried and praised.

title: Did Columbia’s Deal With Trump Save Its Stature or Sacrifice It?
summary: Reactions ranged from fierce criticism to relief after the university reached a settlement over allegations that it failed to stop the harassment of Jewish students.

title: How Will David Ellison Tackle the Big Problems at Paramount?
summary: The cable business has cratered. The news division is in turmoil. A.I. is coming for movies. And those are just the obvious challenges.

title: A Drag Queen Leaves the Stage on Her Own Terms
summary: Kai Lee Mykels often said her goal was to make straight men uneasy, but that was a gag. Her creator had a bigger goal in mind.

title: Spat Between Thai and Cambodian Leaders Fuels Deadly Border War
summary: A personal feud between two of Southeast Asia’s political titans is inflaming the worst violence on the border in more than a decade.

title: Thailand Warns of War With Cambodia as Deadly Clashes Enter 2nd Day
summary: More than 100,000 people have been displaced in the deadliest conflict between the two nations in 14 years.

title: What to Know About the Thailand-Cambodia Clash
summary: The countries continued to trade fire on Friday, and at least 16 people are reported to have been killed.

title: New York Historical Acquires Bill Cunningham Archive
summary: Tens of thousands of photos, negatives and memorabilia from the New York Times photographer (himself designated a living landmark) will go to the museum and have a permanent home.

title: The Line Trump Crossed by Accusing Obama of Treason
summary: President Trump’s history of intemperate remarks has earned him a perverse kind of immunity; the more outrageous his statement, the faster it is often dismissed.

title: The World Must See Gaza’s Starvation
summary: Today, many children in Gaza are so hungry they may never recover, and our supplies are critically low.

title: The Starvation Spreading in Gaza
summary: Gaza is descending into anarchy.

title: For Late Night, Epstein-Trump Is the Comedy Gift That Keeps On Giving
summary: Josh Johnson said that “not since Tupac Shakur has a dead man dropped so many bangers.”

title: Alina Habba Is Named Acting U.S. Attorney in New Jersey
summary: Ms. Habba’s tenure as interim U.S. attorney was slated to end this week, but the Trump administration’s appointment will allow her to remain the top law enforcement official in the state.

title: Cleo Laine, Acclaimed British Jazz Singer, Is Dead at 97
summary: Known for a smoky voice that she could deploy over four octaves, she recorded albums across six decades and also had success as an actress.

title: Was This Artifact From King Tut’s Tomb? It’s for Sale Anyway.
summary: A London auction house says there is “no documented evidence” that an intricately carved grasshopper is from the boy king’s tomb. Its estimated price is up to $675,000.

title: First Deportation Flights Depart From Florida’s ‘Alligator Alcatraz’
summary: Gov. Ron DeSantis said hundreds of immigration detainees had departed a state-run detention center in the Everglades on planes, some for federal facilities, and others out of the country.
